bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Robert P. Cooke, October 3, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison hopes Cooke will attend the upcoming ceremony honoring Lazear at Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Robert P. Cooke, October 3, 1940
div1.p:
On October twenty-fifth and twenty-sixth
Washington and Jefferson College is dedicating a
building to the memory of Doctor Lazear who was a
student here. The yellow fever experiment in which
you participated will be a feature of this occasion.
The play “Yellow Jack” will be given on Friday
evening the twenty-fifth. On the twenty-sixth there
will be formal exercises in the morning, a football
game in the afternoon and a dinner in the evening.

In view of the heroic part which you took in
that experiment, Washington and Jefferson College
invites you to come as its guest for this occasion.
We will pay your travel expenses and will entertain
you while here. We would want to have you as our
guest at the play where you would be introduced and
on Saturday morning at the exercises we would make
public recognition of what you did at that time. At
the dinner in the evening we would ask you to give
a greeting one minute in length. Doctor Hench is the
speaker at the evening dinner. Mr. Moran and Mr.
Kissinger will be here.

We would appreciate it very much if you would
wire at our expense indicating whether you will be
able to accept our invitation.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, (Signed) Ralph Cooper Hutchison Doctor Robert P. Cooke
Lexington-Rockbridge Health Department
Lexington, Virginia
RCH/H
